## useLocalTheme variable

React hook to apply multiple CSS variables to generated local root element and manipulate them.

**Signature:**

```typescript
useLocalTheme: (theme: ThemeType) => {
    setTheme: (nextTheme: ThemeType) => void;
    getTheme: () => ThemeType;
    LocalRoot: FC<JSX.IntrinsicAttributes & {
        children?: ReactNode;
        className?: string;
    }>;
    ref: React.MutableRefObject<HTMLDivElement>;
    getVariable: (variableName: keyof ThemeType) => string;
    setVariable: (variableName: keyof ThemeType, variableValue: string) => void;
}
```

## Example

const {<!-- -->setTheme, getTheme, Component, getVariable, setVariable<!-- -->} = useLocalTheme(<!-- -->{<!-- -->foo: 'bar'<!-- -->}<!-- -->); const setThemeIvory = () =<!-- -->&gt; { setTheme(<!-- -->{<!-- -->foo: 'ivory'<!-- -->}<!-- -->); console.log('full theme', getTheme()) // =<!-- -->&gt; {<!-- -->foo: 'ivory'<!-- -->}<!-- -->; console.log('foo value', getVariable('foo')) // =<!-- -->&gt; 'ivory'; }<!-- -->; return <Component className="demo-local">//...
